goals.description: Launch 'Recipe Creator' Marketplace MVP
Complete Prototype & Validate: MVP Blueprint phase
Transform HelloFresh into the 'Spotify for food' - a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills
Launch in CA (Canada) first

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace with influencers
Curated recipe creator marketplace with aggregators
Instant purchase as meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'
Verified Original Recipe badge for influencer-created content
Recipe scoring based on formatting and completeness
Reliability meter for recipes
Automatic flagging of recipes missing critical info (times, measurements, yields)
Shoppable, cookable meal kits from influencer recipes
deprioritized: Long-term vision: Full 'Spotify for food' platform (any creator can share)

dependencies: Design assets and prototypes (Marc, Shay Obaidullah)
SLT sponsorship approval (Ed Boyes, Ian Brooks)

risks.risk: Competitive threat - Influencers already solving problem with Instacart links; Pinterest partnering with Instacart for 1-click grocery lists
risks.mitigation: Act now with urgency; differentiate with holistic meal kit offering vs individual ingredients

risks.risk: Recipe quality and completeness variability from influencers
risks.mitigation: Implement verification badges, recipe scoring system, reliability meter, and automatic flagging of incomplete recipes

risks.risk: Dependency on influencer content creation and platform independence
risks.mitigation: Provide new revenue stream for influencers to reduce platform dependency and expand reach

initiatives: Design system with verification badges and reliability scoring
Social commerce integration for shoppable content

goals.description: Integrate AI into every step of product manager daily workflow
Automate intelligence-based repetitive work through AI integration
Establish comprehensive AI-enabled process with reusable core components and best practices

key_results.metric: Product manager efficiency and delivery speed
key_results.target: Increased output to meet recalibrated leadership expectations

in_scope: AI integration into daily product management workflow
Training on effective use of AI tools
Establishing AI-enabled ways of working
Context-driven/spec-driven development
Maintaining domain context clarity
Using NotebookLM for team reporting and stakeholder sharing
Building comfort level with GenAI
Understanding GenAI benefits and limitations
deprioritized: Comprehensive coverage of every SDLC aspect
Over-focus on existing products and tools

dependencies: HelloFresh AI exploration and deployment initiatives

risks.risk: Product managers may over-rely on AI without taking personal responsibility for outputs
risks.mitigation: Establish principle that PMs remain personally responsible for all AI-generated content, data, findings, and priorities

risks.risk: AI limitations may not be well understood leading to misapplication
risks.mitigation: Emphasize that AI isn't end-all-be-all; balance where to use AI; focus on building understanding of fundamental benefits and limitations

risks.risk: Technology is in infancy and lacks strong product cases and integrations
risks.mitigation: Remain curious, flexible and quick; experiment and try new things; build confidence through practice

risks.risk: Increased delivery and efficiency expectations may stretch team members
risks.mitigation: Mitigate through automation of intelligence-based repetitive work via AI integration

initiatives: NotebookLM integration for team reporting (MAR/QARs and tactical reports)

entities.context: Contributor who reacted positively to context concepts

entities.context: Company actively exploring and deploying AI-based tools across functions

entities.context: Product management team implementing GenAI ways of working

goals.description: Launch 'Recipe Creator' Marketplace MVP
Complete Prototype & Validate: MVP Blueprint phase
Launch in Canada first
Transform HelloFresh into 'Spotify for food' - platform where any creator can share recipes fulfilled by HelloFresh

key_results.target: On time delivery for Jan/Feb 2026 handover

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace with influencers
Curated recipe creator marketplace with aggregators
Instant purchase as meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'
Serve influencers looking for new revenue streams
Provide followers easy way to purchase ingredients and cook recipes
Canada first launch
Prototype testing and validation
deprioritized: Long-term vision: Open platform for any creator (Spotify for food model)

dependencies: Design assets from Marc and Shay Obaidullah
Bi-weekly stakeholder approvals for phase progression

risks.risk: Competitive threat - Instacart already partnering with Pinterest and influencers for ingredient ordering
risks.mitigation: Act now with urgency; differentiate with holistic meal kit offering vs individual ingredients

risks.risk: Influencer pricing expectations unclear
risks.mitigation: Gather data on pricing expectations around 'set your own price' concept during prototype testing

risks.risk: Recipes missing critical information (times, measurements, yields)
risks.mitigation: Automatically flag recipes missing critical info as reliability meter

risks.risk: Influencers lack awareness of similar services for comparison
risks.mitigation: Focus on understanding missing features that would increase value rather than comparing to competitors

initiatives: Design flow charts and wireframes in Miro and Figma
Bi-weekly stakeholder presentations with GO/NO-GO approvals

goals.description: Explore desired and viable vision for a curated recipe creator marketplace with instant purchase as a meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'
goals.owner: Annette MvdE (Experience Strategy), Melanie Schwindt (Business Strategy), Wanderley Teixeira (Tech Execution)

goals.description: Hand-over to Squad
Launch in CA first
Transform HelloFresh into the 'Spotify for food' - a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills

key_results.target: Score recipes based on clear formatting and completeness with reliability meter
Automatically flag recipes missing critical info (times, measurements, yields)

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace
Influencer partnerships (primary)
Aggregators (secondary)
Instant purchase as meal kit
Fulfillment by HelloFresh
MVP Blueprint development
Prototype & Validate phase
User research with influencers
Recipe quality scoring system
deprioritized: Open platform for any creator (deferred to later phase)

dependencies: Design assets and prototypes (Marc, Shay Obaidullah)

risks.risk: Competitors already solving the problem (Instacart partnerships with influencers and Pinterest)
risks.mitigation: Act with urgency; differentiate with holistic meal kit offering vs individual ingredients

risks.risk: Influencers heavily controlled by platforms, seeking independence
risks.mitigation: Position as new revenue stream and authentic engagement channel

risks.risk: Recipe quality and completeness variability
risks.mitigation: Implement scoring system and automatic flagging of incomplete recipes

risks.risk: Project timeline and squad handover coordination
risks.mitigation: Maintain on-time status with weekly updates and bi-weekly gated decisions

goals.description: Explore desired and viable vision for a curated recipe creator marketplace with instant purchase as a meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'
Hand-over to Squad for execution
Launch in CA (Canada) first
Transform HelloFresh into the 'Spotify for food' - a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills

key_results.baseline: Phase 3: Prototype & Validate - MVP Blueprint, Sprint 4 Week 1
key_results.target: Complete MVP and hand-over to squad
Score recipes based on clear formatting and completeness with reliability meter

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace (1. influencer, 2. Aggregators)
Instant purchase as meal kit fulfilled by HelloFresh
Prototype and validation
User research with influencers
Recipe scoring based on formatting and completeness
Automatic flagging of recipes missing critical info (times, measurements, yields)
CA (Canada) market launch
deprioritized: Long-term vision: 'Spotify for food' platform (deferred to later phase)

dependencies: Design assets and prototypes (Marc, Shay Obaidullah, Annette MvdE)

risks.risk: Competitive threat - Influencers already solving problem with Instacart links; Pinterest partnering with Instacart for 1-click grocery lists
risks.mitigation: Act with urgency; differentiate with holistic offering of complete recipe ingredients and direct delivery vs. individual food items

risks.risk: Recipe quality and completeness issues
risks.mitigation: Implement recipe scoring system and automatic flagging of missing critical information

risks.risk: Influencer pricing expectations unclear
risks.mitigation: Gather data on pricing expectations during user research sessions

goals.description: Launch 'Recipe Creator' Marketplace MVP
Launch in Canada first
Transform HelloFresh into the 'Spotify for food' - a platform where any creator can share a recipe that HelloFresh fulfills
Create curated recipe creator marketplace with instant purchase as meal kit 'fulfilled by HelloFresh'

key_results.metric: Attract new customers through social commerce
Create new revenue stream for influencers
Convert social media recipe inspiration into shoppable meal kits

in_scope: Curated recipe creator marketplace (1. influencer, 2. Aggregators)
Instant purchase as meal kit option
MVP Blueprint development (Sprint 4)
Prototype & Validate phase
Score recipes based on clear formatting and completeness
Reliability meter for recipes
Automatically flag recipes missing critical info (times, measurements, yields)
User research and prototype testing
deprioritized: Full 'Spotify for food' platform (deferred to long-term vision)
Open platform for any creator (limited to curated marketplace initially)

dependencies: Design Assets from Marc and Shay Obaidullah

risks.risk: Competitors already solving the problem (Instacart partnerships with influencers and Pinterest)
risks.mitigation: Act with urgency; differentiate with holistic meal kit offering vs individual ingredients

risks.risk: Recipe quality and completeness from influencers
risks.mitigation: Implement vetting process, scoring system, and reliability meter; automatically flag incomplete recipes

risks.risk: Misspelled AI words and small text in prototype may confuse test participants
risks.mitigation: Export higher resolution pictures or recreate content for clarity

risks.risk: Dependency on influencer platform control
risks.mitigation: Provide influencers independence from heavily controlled platforms through new revenue stream

initiatives: Recipe vetting and quality scoring system

goals.description: Enable a Reliable, Engaged, and Efficient Front-Line Workforce
goals.owner: Shawn Spanier, Philipp Börner, James Gorman

goals.description: Enable a high performance culture and increase our talent density
goals.owner: Shawna Fehrman-Lee, Yasar Ahmad, Syed Ali Abbas

goals.description: Implement Total Rewards Strategy
Build Leaner & Faster Organization

in_scope: Scalable people foundation aligned with Highlander project
Global Workforce Health Mechanism implementation
Global Workday/FreshField Implementation for 100% workforce coverage
Defining & Reporting on Business Talent Objectives with quarterly GLT reviews
HRBP partnership with COEs on talent processes
Quality, Packaging and Ingredient SKU innovation support
XL Menu Expansion support
Efficiency Program/Cost to Serve initiatives
Standardizing operational jobs and career progression
Labor planning approach standardization
Employee relations and policy frameworks
deprioritized: Addressing low Foodie budgets and salary bands (noted as stakeholder disappointment if excluded)
Increasing business leader discretion on Foodie raises allocation

dependencies: Partnership with operations for workforce health reviews
Manager capability building for independent people management
Organizational maturity in processes and ways of working

risks.risk: Organization may not be ready for standardization without building managerial and organizational capability first
risks.mitigation: Focus on building managerial capability as foundation before full standardization

risks.risk: HR remains overstretched providing compensatory support instead of enabling self-sufficient leaders
risks.mitigation: Invest in leadership capability development to reduce HR dependency

risks.risk: Meaningful spikes in unplanned work requiring re-prioritization
risks.mitigation: Not specified

risks.risk: Managers lack skills to independently handle people issues, engagement, and grievance management
risks.mitigation: Build managerial capability through training and support

risks.risk: Top performer attrition due to low Foodie budgets and salary bands
risks.mitigation: Address compensation issues (noted as potential 2026 priority)

initiatives: Scalable people foundation: Define operational jobs and career progression
Establish staffing footprint standards based on building type and size
Standardize shift schedules and labor planning approach
Create employee relations and policy frameworks
Global Workforce Health Mechanism with weekly reviews
Enhanced reconciliation for contingent labor invoicing
Employee communication through engagement feedback loops
Define concrete talent objectives with HRBPs
Implement quarterly GLT reporting on talent initiatives
Design target footprint for MD organization
Implement multi-location talent strategy for Engineers in tech team
SSC case resolution at SLA for Tier 0/1
